explanation.rules:
Rules:
• A Jaqaru word = ROOT + (≤ 3) suffixes; each added suffix may delete (elide) the vowel immediately before it.
• Oral possessor suffixes = ‑p”a, ‑sa; they always delete the preceding vowel.
• Oral case / other suffixes = ‑p”a, ‑t”a, ‑psa, ‑txi; they delete the vowel if it comes from another suffix, but keep it if it belongs to the root.
• Nasal possessor suffixes = ‑nha, ‑ma; nasal case suffix = ‑na.
• Nasal suffixes delete the vowel only when they keep their own vowel; if they lose their vowel, the preceding vowel remains.

Nasal possessor suffixes = -nha, -ma; nasal case suffix = -na.
Nasal suffixes delete the vowel only when they keep their own vowel; if they lose their vowel, the preceding vowel remains.
